SENT.plain: The aims and experience of work in a specialist memory clinic' are described with reference to the first 200 patients attending the service
93.5% of attenders were found to suffer from dementia
67.9% of these fulfilled criteria for probable/possible Alzheimer's disease or other primary degenerative dementias and 8.6% fulfilled criteria for vascular dementia
In the remaining cases the aetiology of the dementia was considered to be multifactorial
The memory clinic proved to be an important resource for demented patients, their carers, and for research projects
